results.title: Song of the road = Pather panchali
results.creator_credit: Government of West Bengal and Satyajit Ray
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel of the same name by Bibhutibhusan Banerji, this is the first part of Satyajit Ray’s renowned trilogy of films about Apu, the son of a would-be writer in a small Bengal village, who grows up in poverty before setting off with what remains of his family to seek a living in Benares. It shows Apu as a young boy experiencing his first taste of the delights and tragedies of life. The film is universally regarded as a great work of poetic cinema. Music provided by Ravi Shankar. Bengali dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Song of the prairie
results.brief_description: An animated puppet satire on the American western genre. Amusing stereotypes of typical characters from cowboy films which range from the whisky-swilling stagecoach driver and evil villain to the innocent heroine and singing hero. Music by Jan Rychlik.
results.description: An animated puppet satire on the American western genre. Amusing stereotypes of typical characters from cowboy films which range from the whisky-swilling stagecoach driver and evil villain to the innocent heroine and singing hero. Music by Jan Rychlik.

results.title: Song of the paddle
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brand, Marrin Canell and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: Outdoorsman Bill Mason takes his wife and two children on a wilderness canoe camping holiday. In this film the art of canoeing is more than technical expertise; it becomes a family experience of shared joy. Along the way there are countless adventures and much lovely scenery, including the Indian rock carvings of Lake Superior

results.title: Song of the Clyde
results.brief_description: A study of the Clyde River, from its source at Elvanfoot to its mouth a Glasgow. This ships built on Clydesdale are famous throughout the world. The film shows the docks, shipyards, and wharves which line the Clyde as it enters the sea. Written by Harold Purcell. Music composed by George Posford, arranged and conducted by Peter Yorke.

results.title: Song of the canary
results.brief_description: Coal miners once took caged canaries into the mines. By collapsing and dying, the tiny birds warned of the presence of deadly gases. Today workers themselves have become the canaries for other workers and society as a whole. The film examines lethal industrial-linked disease in factory workers as well as management and official indifference to this problem.

results.title: Song of Ceylon
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit, John Grierson and Basil Wright
results.brief_description: A poetic interpretation of the life and customs of the people of Ceylon, showing the contrast between the culture of the Singalese of the island, and the western economic outlook. One of the most famous of the GPO Film Unit’s productions, this film helped to build the reputation of the British documentary film movement. ‘The Song of Ceylon’ is in four sections, 1. The Buddha, 2. The Virgin island, 3. The Voice of commerce, 4. The Apparel of God. Sponsored by the Ceylon Tea Propaganda Board. Music by Walter Leigh. Photographed by Basil Wright.

results.creator_credit: Castle Films, Universal Pictures and Edward Cline

results.title: Song & dance = Song and dance
results.creator_credit: Really Useful Films, Cameron Mackintosh and Tom Gutteridge
results.brief_description: This presentation of Andrew Lloyd Webber’s Song and Dance was recorded live for television at the Palace Theatre, London. It is a musical in two acts with the first act “Song - Tell me on a Sunday” featuring the beautiful voice of Sarah Brightman in the role of Emma, and the second act “Dance - Variations” starring dancer Wayne Sleep in the role of Joe. Lyrics by Don Black, choreography by Anthony Van Laast and musical direction by David Caddick.

results.title: Sonatine
results.creator_credit: Shouchiku Daiichi Kougyo, Bandai Visual Company and Takeshi Kitano
results.brief_description: Like most Takeshi Kitano films, the body of this story is made up of the small details within the greater narrative, like the contemplative moments a couple shares, or the morbid retrospections before a bloody action shoot-out. The quiet observations momentarily disrupted by a sudden outburst of intense violence. In this glorious low tempo Yakuza film Kitano stars as a stoic gangster in desperate need of a holiday. When a ‘job’ goes wrong, Kitano and his gang are forced to retreat to a seaside hideaway. What follows is a series of beautifully observed deadpan scenes which constantly challenge our notions of what we have come to expect from the gangster genre. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Aya Kikumai, Tetsu Watanabe, Masanobu Katsumura, Sesumu Terajima and Ren Osugi.

results.title: Sonata in Brussels
results.brief_description: A portrait of life in a capital city. the noise of a crowd swarming around a city hotel is offset by the cooing of pigeons in the bird market; the mute dialogues in the parks, the clamour of the flea circus; the traffic jams, the whistle of the policeman which hypnotises the mannequins in a shop window; the cries of the street urchins; the music of the city. Without commentary.
